author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Seneca
quote: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.

author: Epictetus
quote: Happiness and freedom begin with a clear understanding of one principle: Some things are within our control, and some things are not.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

author: Seneca
quote: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.

author: Epictetus
quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Well-being is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Seneca
quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with Nature.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

author: Seneca
quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.

author: Epictetus
quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

author: Seneca
quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.

author: Epictetus
quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason, and against nature.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.

author: Seneca
quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Happiness is a good flow of life.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.

author: Seneca
quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.

author: Epictetus
quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than losing our time, for it's irretrievable.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

author: Seneca
quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.

author: Epictetus
quote: Only the educated are free.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Extravagance is its own destroyer.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.

author: Seneca
quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.

author: Epictetus
quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: All the good are friends of one another.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.

author: Seneca
quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.

author: Epictetus
quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Steel your sensibilities, so that life shall hurt you as little as possible.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Seneca
quote: He who is brave is free.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Nothing is more hostile to a firm grasp on knowledge than self-deception.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its.
